name: International Association of Aviation Personnel Schools
goal:
IAAPS aims to represent the interests and views of the global Aviation Training Industry worldwide in negotiations and discussions with International and National Aviation Authorities and Regulatory Bodies, Governments, other aviation organisations, unions and representative bodies, media and the public.

IAAPS aims to contribute to the improvement, enhancement and increased safety of the initial training of professional ab-initio pilot, cabin crew and air traffic controllers.

IAAPS aims are restricted to those elements of professional training which might extend from preliminary assessment and preparatory training up to and including initial line qualification. Membership may therefore include TRTOs, FTOs, manufactures, airlines and academic institutions. The Association’s aims do not, however, extend to cover recurrent or other forms of advanced training for qualified aviation personnel of any category.


STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES

IAAPS objectives are as follows:

 The utilisation and promotion of new technologies, systems, materials and methods to enhance the cost-effectiveness and safety of aviation training solutions

 The global exchange of best practices to contribute to enhanced safety, effectiveness and efficiencies in aviation training

 The provision of advice, support and assistance to national and international regulatory authorities to guide the development, implementation and operation of training syllabi and regulation

 To act as a representative body with Governments, Authorities and other institutions and organizations to ensure that full and proper consideration is given to the setting and regulation of initial aviation training programmes worldwide

IAAPS participates in Rule Making Tasks and Stakeholders Advisory Board of EASA to be have a voice in preparation of rule making activities.
euInitiatives: IAAPS represents the aviation personnel training industry in EASA (European Aviation Safety Agency)  e.g SAB(Stakeholders Advisory Board ), subcommittee flight standards, Subcommittee ATM (Air Traffic Management), Management board EASA, FCL (Flight Crew Licinsing)  and Industry Policy Training Group, RMT.0599 Competency based training and Evidence based training.
